table.name: Rumors and Odd Jobs
table.caption: Rumor
rows: There's talk that gold has been discovered in the hills beyond the old forest.
A local herb shop is paying for rare specimens.
A group of vampires is moving this way. Well, that's what that wild-eyed man said last night at the inn. Who's ever heard of such nonsense?
A horse was stolen out of the stable last night. The stable boy was hit on the head and knocked out
On the night of a full moon, if you hear a robin's call and toss a silver coin into the town's well, your wish will be granted.
A pickpocket is working in the upscale district.
A circus is supposed to be coming to town in a couple of days.
Three teens set out from town a week ago after buying rope and some rations. Now, their parents are offering a reward to anyone who can bring them back.
The Lord Mayor is hiring adventurers to look into reports of goblin activity around the ruins in the high forest.
A farmer outside of town is said to have a chicken that lays golden eggs.
Slavers raided a village in the hills a week ago. The mayor was afraid to send a party to investigate.
There are whispers of a rebellion against the town leadership. Could new leadership be any worse?
A drunk broke some tables in the inn the other night. He shouted he would teach town a lesson. No one has seen him since.
A body was found dead near the edge of town. His pack included a map.
The owner of the inn is looking to sell.
A group of newcomers is gathering at a local common house for "meetings" one night a week. Well, that's what is being said anyway.
An elf is buying a lot of books around the city.
The town down the road discovered a vast sum of treasure.
Farmer Beullo found thousands of dead birds in his field a few days ago.
A wealthy halfling merchant is supposedly outfitting an ocean expedition.
No one has seen the owner of the old mansion on the hill in more than two years.
A local merchant is offering a reward to anyone who brings back artifacts from the ruins up in the hills.
A musclebound dwarf is offering a large sum of gold to anyone who can best him in a series of feats of strength.
There's talk that the fire at the mill the other night was set by a drifter. The mayor wants to question him.
Several children found a basket that was sealed with tar floating down the river. They say there was a baby inside.
Travelers are telling stories about ruins uncovered in the wilderness about a three-day journey from the city.
The thieves' guild is going to overthrow the town government. Well, that's what a disgraced politician has been saying.
A stranger has been offering payment for information on the strength of the town guard.
Three different people say the spirit of an elf princess appeared to them near the town square in the last week.
Travelers coming down river say blight is spreading among scattered farms.
The shopkeeper at the general store said old Riston didn't come into town for supplies this week.
A mercenary troop is recruiting. Food and wages are offered, but the main benefit is a life of war.
The old man who lives in the cave on the hill has been hiring workers lately.
A drunken guardsman said an ancient scroll was found in the town square.
Several fishermen reported seeing a glow underwater the last few nights. Those old fools are probably drinking again.
A store burned down last week. Whispers say a rival merchant paid the arsonist.
If you stare into the eyes of the inn's cat too long, it will steal your soul. That's what happened to the poor kitchen hand who went mad.
A band of rangers has been gathering at the inn every night this week. Their number is growing and commonfolk are starting to worry.
A nearby fountain was found filled with blood this morning.
Strange cloud formations have been seen over one mountain to the west.
A young farm girl said she saw a dragon flying to the east three days ago.
Wreckage of a raft was found floating downriver by some folk doing laundry. They say there was a logbook.
A reward is being offered for the capture of some vandals.
Several disappearances were noticed after a strange ship left port the other night. Just talk, no one important is missing.
A lost child was found with a spellbook. The authorities are investigating.
The king's son is planning to overthrow and murder his father.
Several people say they have seen lights up at the old mine the last few nights.
A miracle worker is said to be traveling from town to town. If the stories are true, he will arrive here tomorrow.
The old lady who lives outside of town is a witch and she has been placing curses on people. Some folks want to drive her out.
A nomadic band is kidnapping children as they move from town to town. If they show up here, what will we do?
A traveling troupe is looking for players. Untold fame and riches await those who join. They haven't had many takers yet.
The mayor is thinking about canceling the festival, because of so many thieves in the city.
A new businesswoman in town is hiring workers to clear a section of woods near the edge of town.
The town's tinker has created a means of mechanical flight. That old fool couldn't create anything.
A strange bard passed through town recently. After he was gone jewels and valuables were reported missing.
A 12-year-old murdered his father the other night. He's being held at the jail, though he denies he did it with much weeping.
A dwarf named, Randarr, is hiring hands for a journey into the mountains.
There's talk of a woman looking for her lost daughter.
Highwaymen are working the north road. No one has really seen them, but no one wants to go that way now.
One of the town guards said some children found a bundle of gold pieces in the river.
A burglar has been working in the wealthy section of town. Always enters in the second story and only takes gems.
A robber baron is collecting "tolls" from travelers along the east road.
A rich dwarf is hiring hands to help import stone from a dwarven stronghold.
A statue of a god was stolen from the city square two nights ago. Strange how no one saw anything.
An outlying farm was raided a few days ago. The farmer says it was goblins, of course, that can't be.
A band of mercenaries swept into town about a week ago broke a lot of things, spent lots of money, and then moved out yesterday.
Some say they have seen a man carrying a coffin on his back the last two nights.
There has been a string of late-night arsons recently.
That crazy old wizard, Cilivren, is offering 500 gold pieces for a book.
Some dockworkers say dragon scales are washing ashore down at the wharf.
On a nearby mountain top is a man who will give you a stone that will protect you.
The dispute between the metalsmiths and the wood smiths is close to turning violent. Well, at least, that's what that drunken gnome said.
Travelers from the west are telling tales of a wizard building a great library.
There's been a lot of nighttime activity at the general store lately.
The old hermit came into town the other day. He said the old dam upriver is leaking. No one believes him, because he's crazy. That dam hasn't broken in hundreds of years.
One of the servers at the inn is looking to hire on with a group of adventurers.
An expedition that set out a month ago. Their horses found wandering in the forest, but there was no sign of the adventurers.
A man has been coming to the inn the last few nights looking to hire protection.
Some of the farming families on the outskirts of town are saying several gangs of prospectors moved up into the hills recently.
Some say dogs and cats are disappearing around town lately.
Wizards and other magic folk are passing through town. Some "great alignment" is going to happen next month and the best observation spot is to the west.
Krieg was heard arguing with a stranger the other night, now he has disappeared.
That crazy old lady who lives alone by the lake says a monster lives in it.
Wreckage from a ship washed ashore by the docks. There was one badly injured survivor. He's being cared for by the sheriff's family.
Travelers are telling tales of traps set along the south road.
The merchant ship, Cromwell, didn't arrive last month and is thought lost with all hands.
There are stories of a giant red wolf attacking travelers within the last month.
A sea captain is hiring hardy souls for a long voyage.
An art collector has moved into town and is paying for valuable items.
An elven woman has been coming to the inn every night for a week asking about someone named, Gulien.
There are whispers one of the town's wealthy merchants is hiring adventurers and mercenaries.
A businessman is hiring hands to cut timber on the mountain slopes.
Travelers are saying a wizard is building a tower on a hill down the river.
Several local merchants have created an exploration company. They are looking for hardy souls to lead expeditions.
A boisterous band of adventurers left town yesterday. Some say they heard them talking about searching for a legendary library.
A bard is threatening to put the entire town to sleep by playing a magic flute. He's just angry because the town laughed at him while he was performing.
A paladin is recruiting adventurers for a holy quest. He promises adventure, blessings, and almost certain death. Wouldn't that be glorious?
There's a disease in the poor section of town. But, who cares?
The odd dwarf blacksmith is hiring workers to open up a mine. They say it will be incredibly dangerous.
The undertaker has discovered a strange key that is said to open the gates of hell. He's always been a scary fellow anyway.

table.name: Inn Encounters
table.caption: Inn Encounter
rows: Group of halfl ings begins singing loudly

A rather ugly young maiden bursts into the room yelling in a strange tongue. Shortly after, a beautiful, but fierce maiden of the same age comes in. She spots the first girl and screams something at her in the same language. She pulls out a magical rope and binds her. Dragging the frightened maiden out of the room, she speaks to no one. Meanwhile, the bound girl is obviously pleading for help in her own language.

Innkeeper demands triple the price for everything the party orders

In a dark corner, a man is sitting alone with his face buried in his hands. Before him is a book. When you gaze at the book, it appears blank, but you feel you could just swear there was writing in it when you first saw it out of the corner of your eye.

A small boy is moving through the crowd, performing magic tricks for a few coins. He has an easy-going, likable manner, and the customers find themselves disposed to indulge him. However, you notice as he moseys about the room, his fingers seem to fi nd the wallets of the preoccupied patrons.

There is a group of formidable-looking women playing cards. One of them keeps eyeing your party. If she catches the party's eye, she grins impishly. She continues to raise the stakes of the game, much to the annoyance of her companions.
Barmaid drops a tray of drinks on the player's table creating a huge mess
An elf keeps staring at the party
Fight breaks out next to the party
A man in pied attire saunters into the room and announces the upcoming dance competition. He assures the customers that the prizes and honor bestowed will be second to none.
Raucous game of darts involving most in the common room
All patrons stare at the party
Common room erupts into a huge brawl
Sign: "Dwarves, we don't serve your kind."

Gang demands protection money from the innkeeper

There's a man dressed in hunter's garb apparently sleeping at his table. In his hand is a strange jewel. Many of the people around the tavern seem to know who he is. Whispering to each other, you hear snippets of conversation concerning the precious stone. Rumors of it being magical, or evil, or both waft across the room. Suddenly and silently the jewel slips from the hunter's grasp and clatters upon the flagstones.
Party is told the dwarf in the corner bought them all drinks
Party is told the elf in the corner bought them all drinks
Innkeeper and patron get into a heated argument
Patron hands the party a sealed letter and says to keep it safe
Several loud crashes shake the inn, they came from the kitchen
A halfling seems to be having trouble lighting his pipe

A young lady in a flamboyant costume is speaking to a mysterious pale-skinned man. She is offering up her unique services for a price. Claiming that she has the ability to hypnotize crowds with her soothing voice and magic-infused mandolin, she makes suggestions that the crowd finds difficult to refuse.
A man bursts in and demands if anyone has seen a person matching this description. He describes one party member to a tee.
Eight angry gnomes enter and appear to be looking for someone

A strange, tiny man is going around peeking in everyone's shoes. He seems to be looking for something of dire importance.

There is an ancient woman sitting by the fire, muttering. She has a strange shard of ice in her hand, which she is shaving with a knife. As she shears off the ice, the shard becomes sharper and sharper. The shavings fall into the fire, creating mysterious bursts of colorful flames as they fall in.

table.name: Cursed Items
table.caption: Cursed Item
rows: Ring of Disappearance - The ring disappears when equipped
Dagger of Volume - The wielder can only communicate by loudly shrieking
Ring of Inn Visibility - Shows the wearer where all inns are within a 300-foot radius
Ring of Personal Invisibility - The wearer is invisible only to themselves
Necklace of the Opera - Causes the wearer to communicate only by operatic singing
Cloak of Tongues - The wearer can taste anything within a 30-yard radius
Deck of Not That Many Things - Only 9 cards, numbers counting to 10 (the number 8 is missing)
Boots of Feather Falling - A ton of feathers fall on the wearer every time they step outside
Bagpipes of Invisibility - The wielder is invisible as long as they are playing the bagpipes
Necklace of Mind Reading - Anyone within a 30 feet radius can read the wearer's mind
Shield of Overconfidence - Compels the bearer to take unnecessary risks
Staff of Judgment - Judgmental talking staff; constant passive-aggressive comments
Ring of Teleportation - The ring teleports anywhere the wearer wills; the wearer does not teleport with it
Bag of Spewing - A bag of holding that shoots out items that are mentioned in a conversation
Gauntlets of Hilarity - Causes the wearer to giggle uncontrollably at inappropriate times
Warhammer of Chicken Detection - Glows bright yellow when there is a chicken within 30 feet
Sword of Dancing - The wielder dances uncontrollably when in combat
Gloves of Pickpocketing - Allows others to pickpocket the wearer easier
Sword of Pain - Screams in agony whenever it hits something
Amulet of Pitch - Causes the wearer's voice to be two octaves higher
Shield of Protection - In combat, it uses the bearer's body to shield itself from harm
Wand of Detect Magic Item - Detects the nearest magic item (itself)
Ring of Confident Invisibility - The wearer becomes slightly stealthier; they also become convinced that they are completely invisible
Helm of Relentless Growth - Causes the wearer's hair to grow so fast it pushes the helm off
Mask of Near-Perfect Disguise - Disguises the wearer as a near-perfect imitation of themselves
Singing Frog - Sings constantly when alone with its owner; stops singing and croaks like a normal frog when anyone else is near enough to hear it
Vest of Cursed Hearing - The wearer can hear the DM as a voice in their head; others assume they are losing their mind when they speak of this
Rock of Gravity Detection - Hold out and release, if it falls gravity is working
Pants of Cursed Knowledge - The wearer is acutely aware of the fact that they are a character in a role-playing game; they are unable to convince others of this
Hat of Luck Reversal - The wearer is generally unlucky, prone to ridiculous scenarios and sticky situations
Axe of Scents - Does no damage; makes the target smell bad
Necklace of Mind Control - Allows the wearer to control their own mind
Glove of Slipperiness - Makes it difficult to hold items
Goggles of Darkvision - Makes everything appear darker
The Twin Daggers - Two sentient daggers that hate each other
Hat of Marvel - Reduces the wearer's intelligence to 3, but convinces others that the wearer is a genius
Candle of Flame Resistance - It's a fireproof candle
Bag of Bags of Holding - A bag of holding that can only hold bags of holding
Boots of Waterwalking - The wearer can walk on shallow water of 3 inches depth or less
Boots of Tracking - Leaves behind deep footprints that are easy to track
Sword of Lightning - 5% chance for the wielder to be struck by lightning when used
Ring of the Ring - Allows the wearer to equip one more ring than they otherwise could
Locket of Impression - After a few days of wearing this, the wearer has a vague impression that something isn't right but has no idea what
Cloak of the Weather - A talking cloak that constantly complains about the weather
Sword of Offense - A talking sword that insults the enemy, inflicting {@damage 3d6} emotional damage
Mace of Healing - Heals the target up to {@dice 1d6} hit points; also does {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage
Boots of Invisibility - Turns the wearer's feet invisible (the boots do not become invisible)
Amulet of Existence - This amulet exists
Emerald of Giving - Compels the wearer to give away all of their wealth and fortune until there is only the emerald left to give
Ring of Attraction - Attracts bees and wasps

table.name: Critical Success for Spell Attacks
table.caption: Spell Attack Critical Success
rows: Flight - The caster gains the ability to fly for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
No Cost - The spell was used for free
Cursed Finesse - The target has a disadvantage on dexterity for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Multiply - {@dice 1d4} duplicates of the caster appear
Bound - Magical threads entangle the target for {@dice 1d6} rounds. They can be broken can be broken with a strength roll
Healing Aura - All friendly creatures within 30ft of the caster are healed for {@dice 2d10} health
Dispel - All magical effects on the target are dispelled
Steal Voice - The target loses the ability to speak until the curse is removed
Fire Shield - Flames wreathe the caster's body, causing {@damage 1d6} damage to any creature that touches the caster
Enfeeble - The target does half damage on weapon attacks for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Amnesia - The target lapses into insanity and forgets his identity
Guiding Ray - All attack rolls made against the target have advantage for one round
Tether - The target is anchored to the ground for 1 minute and can only move 5ft from its current position.
Magic Barrage - The caster fires a missile of magic as a bonus, {@damage 2d4} damage
Minion - Tf the target dies within {@dice 1d4} turns it is raised again as the caster's ally
Web - The target becomes entangled in a sticky web
Cursed Body - The target has disadvantage on constitution checks for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Cursed Presence - The target has disadvantage on charisma checks for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Interrogate - The caster can ask the target one question at the threat of pain if answered untruthfully
Nightmare - The targets worst fear appears in front of it
Fish Out of Water - The target grows gills and can only breathe water for {@dice 1d6} turns. If the target does not find water, it begins to suffocate
Flaming Blade - Any weapon of the caster's choosing ignites into flames and does an additional {@damage 1d6} burning damage for {@dice 1d6} turns
Disappearing Act - The caster becomes invisible for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Pushing Blast - The target is pushed back 10ft
Cursed Mind - The target has disadvantage on intelligence checks for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Concussive Blast - The target is stunned for one round
Launch - The target is pushed back 20ft
Aggro - All creatures within sight of the target see it as an immediate threat and must use their action to attack it. This lasts until the casters next turn
Brainy Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain advantage on intelligence rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Free Spell - The spell is cast as a bonus action instead of a full action
Bloody Tears - The target is blinded and begins to bleed from the eyes. They take {@damage 2d6} damage on each of their turns for {@dice 1d6} turns
Encircling Wind - A wall of wind appears, encircling the target in a 10ft radius for {@dice 1d6} turns
Tough Skin - The caster gains damage resistance to slashing and piercing damage for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Wise Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain advantage on wisdom rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Storm Caller - The caster can call forth three bolts of lightning for {@damage 3d10} damage each
Zero Gravity - The target floats 5ft into the air for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Magic Shield - The caster gains +2 to defense for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Long Arms - The caster's arms stretch in length, increasing their reach by 5ft
Deafening Blast - All creatures within 10ft of the target must make a constitution save or be deafened
Transformative Ray - The target is transformed into a beast of a small size
Wrecking Ball - Throw the target at any other creature within 30ft of it. Both creatures take {@damage 3d6} damage and are knocked prone
Absorb Energy - Absorb any energy attacks made against caster for {@dice 1d6} turns
Inner Beast - The target behaves as if enraged and confused for {@dice 1d6} turns
Cursed Strength - The target has disadvantage on strength checks and attack rolls for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Magic Winds - The caster gains control of the air around them.
Truth - The target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage if questions are answered untruthfully and has a -10 on deception for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Exhaustion - The target adds -1 to all rolls until they finish a short or long rest
Quicken Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain advantage on dexterity rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Dimensional Rift - The target is transported to a random plane for {@dice 1d4} rounds and then reappears in the same spot
Powerful Blast - The target is knocked prone
Magic Weapons - The caster and all allies within sight treat their weapon attacks as magical and have a +2 on attack and damage rolls for 1 minute
Encircling Flames - A wall of fire appears, encircling the target in a 10ft radius for {@dice 1d6} turns
Déjà vu - The target must repeat the specific actions it took this round again for {@dice 1d4} rounds
Strike True - The caster can give any ally within sight a +20 on their next attack roll
Cursed Beauty - The target's face is horribly disfigured and has disadvantage on persuasion checks until the spell is removed
Adamant Bones - The caster gains damage resistance to bludgeoning damage for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Cursed Spirit - The target has disadvantage on wisdom checks for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Energy Drain - Energy is pulled from the target into the user. Recover health equal to half of the damage dealt
Sluggish - The target is slowed for {@dice 1d4} rounds
Blinding Light - The target is blinded by a brilliant flash of light
Stasis - The target becomes frozen in time for {@dice 1d6} turns and cannot be harmed until the effect ends.
Maze - The target is banished to a labyrinthine dimension.
Extend Spell - Double the duration of the caster's next spell
Quick Feet - Increase the caster's base movement speed by 30ft for 1 hour
Babble - The targets languages are replaced with random new languages
Birthday Suit - The target's armor and clothing are blasted from them
Fear Me - The target is frightened by the caster
Invigorating Spell - Recover {@dice 1d4} spells and receive {@dice 2d6} in healing
Eruption - The target is thrown 60ft into the air and takes fall damage or impact damage if it hits a ceiling
Distant Spell - Double the range of caster's next spell
Dragon Shape - The caster is transformed into a young dragon for {@dice 1d6} turns
Charming Spell - The target must make a wisdom save or be charmed
Charming Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain advantage on charisma rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Stone Curse - The target slowly becomes stone, starting with their arm. If the curse or affected area is not removed within 3 rounds the target is petrified
Protective Blast - The user gains the effect of magic armor
Speedy - The caster gains an additional 10ft of movement for {@dice 1d4} rounds
Paranoia - The target sees everyone as an enemy and becomes hostile
Glowing Ray - For {@dice 1d6} rounds the target is wreathed in fire
Enchanting Spell - The target falls unconscious
Encircling Stone - A wall of stone appears, encircling the target in a 10ft radius for {@dice 1d6} turns
Healing Energy - The caster regains {@dice 2d10} hit points
Fire Ants - The target perceives stinging ants filling their clothing and loses {@dice 1d6} turns scratching
Shrink Ray - The target is reduced in size
Mind Read - Secret thoughts and memories from the target flood the caster's mind
Poisoned Blood - The target is poisoned for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
Disarming Ray - The target drops their weapon or shield
Toughen Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain advantage on constitution rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Flying Daggers - Magical daggers spin around the caster in a 5ft radius for {@dice 1d6} turns. Any creature that enters that radius takes {@damage 5d4} damage.
True Understanding - The caster gains the ability to understand all languages for 1 hour
Empower Allies - The caster and all allies within 30ft gain an advantage on strength rolls for {@dice 1d6} turns
Aging Curse - The target is aged by {@dice 1d12} years
Invulnerable - The caster becomes immune to all damage for {@dice 1d6} turns.
Break - Break any non-magical item the target is holding or wearing
Paralyze - The target must make a wisdom save or be paralyzed for {@dice 1d4} rounds
Suggestion - The caster may make one suggestion to the target
Double Spells - Cast a second spell on the same turn
Explosive Spell - The spell affects any other creature within 5ft of the target
Envious Desire - The target is overwhelmed with envy and must use his action to disarm, grapple, or steal from any target nearby for {@dice 1d6} rounds
Baby Hand - One of the targets hands shrinks to infant size and can no longer hold anything greater than 5lbs

table.name: Blessings
table.caption: Blessing
rows: Fine dining. Whenever you eat out, the dishes are always clean.
Recently bathed. You always smell clean.
I'm on a diet. You can eat half as much as normal.
Quick sleeper. You never have trouble falling asleep.
Upkeep. Your equipment is always in top repair.
Minty. Your breath is always fresh.
Fast metabolism. You can eat all you want without getting fat.
Shades. The sun is never in your eyes.
Everybody knows your name. Your favorite seat at your favorite tavern is always empty.
Quick reader. You never lose your place while reading.
He saved my spot. Nobody ever cares when you cut in line.
Permanent Press. Your clothes are always wrinkle-free.
Golden smile. Your teeth are always free of debris.
Ready to go. You don't experience bedhead.
This little piggy. Stubbing your toes is a thing of the past.
Give me five. Your high fives are never left hanging.
It's on me. If you're short by 5 copper pieces, the person behind you always covers it.
Who do your hairdo? It's impossible for you to have a bad hair day.
Well mannered. You never burp/fart during social interactions, unless you really want to.
Lovely complexion. Your skin is always clear of blemishes.
Laugh attack. Somebody always laughs at your jokes.
Beer me. You never get served warm ale/mead.
Feathered friends. Birds never poop on you. This may have negative effects on those around you.
Just like mama used to make. The food you are served is always served at the correct temperature.
Rose petal. Your farts don't stink.
Pocket lock-it. Nobody ever tries to pick your pocket.
Looking dapper. Your hair is never greasy.
Smooth moves. You have an advantage when trying to avoid tripping.
Alarm clock. You always manage to wake up right when you need/want to.
Mr. Sandman. You always have pleasant dreams.
Forget the odds. If someone tries to attack you, roll {@dice 1d4}. On a 4, they decide to attack someone else.
Looking sharp. It's impossible for you to look disheveled.
Flipside. Your pillow is always on the cool side.
Minor annoyance. Mosquitoes find you repulsive.
Suave. Your preferred gender finds you slightly attractive. You gain temporary proficiency with all social skills used while talking to your preferred gender.
Know it all. You always have the answer to useless trivia questions. Add 5 to your intelligence rolls when rolling for useless information.
Disarming smile. Once a day your smile grants you advantage to persuasion checks.
Nose for trouble. Once a day gain advantage on an insight check.
Walk softly. Once a day gain advantage on a stealth check.
Saw it coming. Once a day for a single round of combat you can add your perception modifier to your AC.
Commanding presence. Once a day gain advantage on an intimidation check.
Honeyed words. Once a day gain advantage on a persuasion check.
Said the liar. Once a day gain advantage on a deception check.
Triathlete. Once a day gain advantage on an athletics check.
Sheep's clothing. Once a day you can select a creature/person and learn their alignment.
Special dispensation. Once a day gain advantage on a religion check
What's yours is mine. Once a day gain advantage on a sleight of hand check.
Soft landing. Once a day gain advantage on an acrobatics check.
Glass half full. Healing potions have two uses for you.
Divine umbrella. For some reason, you never get wet when it rains, snows, or hails.
Graced tongue. You learn a new language.
Penny pincher. Every time you reach into your coin purse, roll {@dice 1d4}. You gain this number of coppers.
Silver tongue. Once a day gain advantage on a performance check.
Guiding spirit. Once a day gain advantage on a saving throw.
Spirit animal. (Pick any animal.) You gain advantage on all skill rolls used on this animal.
Hawkeye. Once a day gain advantage on a ranged attack.
History buff. Once a day gain advantage on a history check.
Self-diagnosed. Once a day gain advantage on a medicine skill check.
Arcane surge. Once a day when either casting a spell or using a magic weapon, double the damage die.
An apple a day. You have advantage on saving throws against disease.
Night owl. Gain 30ft of dark vision. This stacks with pre-existing dark vision.
Quick footed. Your movement/speed is increased by 5ft.
Early bird. From sunrise Until noon, you have proficiency in all skills.
Star born. From sunset to midnight you have proficiency in all skills.
God smack. Once a day deal double bludgeoning damage.
Strong stomach. You have advantage on all constitution saves to avoid being poisoned.
Footwork. Once a day you can ignore rough terrain for the duration of an encounter.
Undead nightmare. Once a day you can cast Turn Undead on ONE target. No spell slots required.
Thick-skinned. When you take slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage, reduce the damage by 1/2 of your Constitution rounded down.
Eagle eye. The range of all ranged attacks/spells is increased by 100ft.
Ignore the pain. Once a day when you are attacked, you can roll {@dice 1d10}. Subtract this number from the damage dealt.
Fueled by pain. If you are dealt 15 points of damage in a single attack, you gain advantage on all rolls made your next turn.
Unmatched immune system. You're resistant to disease.
Shared pain. Once a day, when attacked, you can use a reaction to split the same amount of damage you just received with your attacker.
Sun-kissed. While the sun shines upon you, you gain fire resistance.
Moonchild. While the Moon shines upon you you gain resistance to Cold.
Falling star. If you fall for over 30ft, you can make a melee attack DC 20. If you succeed, you take no damage but deal the damage you would've taken to anyone nearby. This damage is divided equally.
New skill. Gain proficiency in a skill you're not already proficient in.
Rat king. You gain a familiar. This familiar takes the form of a rat. It shares the same stats as a rat. If killed, it returns to you the following day.
Lucky day. You always have an advantage when gambling.
Fortune fairies. Once a week your coin purse gains 2% of the gold it currently has. If you have 100gp, you earn 2gp.
Fey's blessing. You have advantage against being charmed or frightened.
Comeback. Once a day, after throwing a thrown weapon, roll {@dice 1d10}. On a 10, the weapon reappears in your hand.
Return to sender. Once a day, when targeted by a ranged attack/spell, roll {@dice 1d10}. On a 10 the attack/spell targets the attacker instead.
Life-giver. Once a day, when you successfully land an attack, you can heal an ally for the amount of damage you dealt.
Sure-grip. You can no longer be disarmed in combat.
Sure foot. You can no longer be knocked prone.
Anointed. You are resistant to necrotic/unholy damage.
Desecrated. You are resistant to radiant/holy damage.
Death cloak. Once a day, whenever a person dies within 10 ft of you, you regain 3d10hp.

Mind blast. Once a day you can make a wisdom check with a DC of 15. If you succeed, all hostiles within a 15ft radius of you take {@damage 4d4} psychic damage and must immediately make a wisdom/willpower save DC 15. If they fail they are stunned.

Divine javelin. Once a day you can conjure up a javelin of radiant energy. This javelin deals {@damage 2d8} radiant damage if thrown, or {@damage 2d10} radiant damage if used as a melee weapon. It dissipates immediately after use.
Noticed. All ability scores increase by 1
Prodigy. Choose one skill you are proficient in. You now get to double your proficiency with it.
Insane immune system.You are immune to disease.
Blessed. All ability scores increase by 2
Strong mind. You're resistant to psychic damage.
Thick-skinned. You are resistant to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage.
Friend of the elements. You are resistant to Fire, Cold, Lightning, poison, and acid damage.
Known not by death. Once a month, when reduced to 0hp, you bounce back up the following round with full hp, and all class features unused.

"Yes honey, that dress does make you look fat"
Starved to death in a dungeon
Swarmed by thousands of small spiders

Mistaken for dead when actually asleep, buried alive
Never existed in the first place
Eaten from the inside by parasites

Stomped and mauled by an angry yeti
Bludgeoned to death in a tavern brawl
Bitten, clawed, impaled and eventually eaten by a manticore
Thought they could fly (they could not)
Fell off of a tall cliff
Failed to resist a siren's song
Dropped from a great height by a hippogriff
Volunteered for a wizard's research, didn't read the fine print
Left behind in a dangerous dungeon
Died of dehydration in the desert
"I bet I could seduce that half-orc barbarian"
Eaten by rats in a tavern cellar
Overwhelmed by a horde of kobolds
Overwhelmed by a horde of goblins
Tripped and hit their head on a large rock
"It's just a wizard and a clay golem, we can take them"
Faked their own death, got buried alive

All of your attacks are nonlethal

You become tired in the day and overly energetic at night

Your hands stick to anything they touch
All but your head is invisible
You can't stop growing at an alarming rate

Everyone keeps mistaking you for a wanted criminal

table.name: Dungeon Health Side Effects
table.caption: Dungeon Health Side Effect
rows: Sores on the soles of the feet

table.name: Epitaphs
table.caption: Epitaph
rows: All I ever needed was a good blade.
Wisdom comes with age and so does death.
To be or not to be...
From hell's heart, I spit at thee
He must be brave who wishes to wear my crown.
Where did all the time go?
The blade is sharp but he was sharper still.
I had so much to say but now it is too late.
And the tears flow like rain.
I am scattered to the winds.
Can I have but one more chance?
Hatred will be my fuel in the afterlife.
He died as miserably as he lived.
I shall sleep the last sleep.
What joys or horrors await me?
He shrank from nothing, not even death.
Even in life, he was gone.
A king among men. A fool among fools.
All the gold in the world could not save my life.
He came home to his death.
Cursed he who moves my bones.
I put many in the grave, now I join them.
I've hidden my great wealth. I dare you to find it.
Death is not sleep. Sleep is sleep.
Life just began and now I've gone and thrown it all away.
Our beloved child foully murdered by goblins.
All I can say is that she was good.
My body lies but still, I roam.
I tread where no one else dared.
I came. I saw. I died.
There is no doubt she was a queen.
She will always be my love.
He should've looked before he leaped.
Fueled by hate. Consumed by greed.
Here lies the king of fools.
I told you I was sick.
I robbed and I cheated. Now I regret it.
The hero of Innsdale. Felled by an orc arrow.
She died as she lived in a ball of flame.
I shall reclaim my throne in this life or the next.

table.name: Fortunes
table.caption: Fortune
rows: Be bold, you've spent too long sitting around.
You will attend a party where strange customs prevail.
Love can last a lifetime if you want it to.
Be on the lookout for coming events, they cast their shadows beforehand.
Your problem just got bigger. Think just what have you done.
Reward and happiness await you, but there is pain along the way.
In the future, you will discover how fortunate you are.
Your shoes will make you happy today.
He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
Happy news is on its way to you.
You laugh now, wait until you get home.
A new voyage will fill your life with untold memories.
Don't bother looking for fault. The reward for finding it is low.
Find a good friend. Loyalty is needed now more than ever.
You are very talented in many ways.
What doesn't kill you makes you very sick.
Someone close will tell you their true feelings about you soon.
The expanse of your intelligence is a void no universe could ever fill.
You could prosper in the field of entertainment.
A friend asks only for your time, not your money.
Friends long absent are coming back to you.
A chance meeting opens new doors to success and friendship.
Our perception and attitude toward any situation will determine the outcome.
Be cautious while walking in the darkness alone.
You learn from your mistakes... You will learn a lot today.
Three can keep a secret if you get rid of two.
Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
A pleasant surprise is in store for you.
The greatest war sometimes isn't on the battlefield but is against oneself.
When someone offers you a drink, it may be poison.
Perhaps you have been focusing too much on yourself.
You have a deep appreciation of the arts and music.
A thrilling time is in your immediate future.
Keep your eye out for someone special.
If you have something good in your life, don't let it go!
A very attractive person has a message for you.
Your ability for accomplishment will follow with success.
Something you lost will soon turn up.
Never give up. You're not a failure if you don't give up.
Your heart is pure, and your mind clear, and your soul devout.
You can make your own happiness.
Dragon's blood will burn your eyes for 13 hours. You will learn this the hard way.
You will travel to many exotic places in your lifetime.
Your past will catch up to you.
Follow your dreams and they will come true.
The end is near and it will be all your fault.
You are admired for your adventurous ways.
As the purse is emptied the heart is filled.
Sing tonight, it may be your last chance.
A stranger will offer you a gift soon.
They say you are stubborn; you call it persistence.
Two small jumps are sometimes better than one big leap.
Your many hidden talents will become obvious to those around you.
Your hair speaks volumes about you.
Keep your goals away from the trolls.
There is a true and sincere friendship between you and your friends.
Now is the time to try something new.
You shouldn't overspend at the moment. Frugality is important.
Your family will be cursed forever and eternity.
Let there be magic in your smile and firmness in your handshake.

Adversity is the parent of virtue.

Pray for what you want, but work for the things you need.
If you feel you are right, stand firmly by your convictions.
Chart your own course. No one else knows your heart.

You are blessed, today is the day to bless others.

You will meet someone tall, dark, and handsome soon.
Your artistic talents win the approval and applause of others.
The sunshine of your presence will be evident to all.
People in your background will be more cooperative than usual.

A danger foreseen is half avoided.

table.name: Magic Items
table.caption: Magic Item
rows: Great Sword of Dane - Whoever is attuned to this great sword can summon three war dogs during combat up to twice per day. The dogs can be dismissed at will
Ring of Storms - This ring allows the wearer to cast a thunder spell four times a day
Key of Secrets - When used on any keyhole there is a 5% chance it will unlock that object. There is also a 5% chance it will open a room or object located on a different plane of existence
Cloak of Flying - This cloak allows the wearer 5 minutes of flight, once per day. Their flying speed is 60ft

Rapier of the Vampire - This rapier drains the life force of its victims, and gifts it to its master. Whenever the wielder lands a successful attack with this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} corruption damage, and heals the wielder equal to the damage dealt

Dragon's Tail - This flail was made from the heart of a dragon. When found roll {@dice 1d6}= 1)fire 2)frost 3)lightning 4)acid 5)poison 6)player's choice. This flail deals an extra {@damage 1d8} of the damage type rolled
Harp of Sleep - This harp can be used to cast {@dice 1d6} sleep spells per day

Mask of Elements - While this mask is equipped, the wearer may use an action to harness the elements. Roll {@dice 1d4}. 1) Air 2) Earth 3) Fire 4) Water. The wearer assumes the shape of the Elemental rolled. When the wearer's health drop to or below 0, they revert back to their original form with one health

Bow of Smiting - This longbow has a range of 650ft. It deals {@damage 1d8} damage, plus an additional {@damage 2d6} holy damage. If the wielder is attacking an undead creature, it deals {@damage 6d6} bonus holy damage instead

Pair of Skeletal Feet - These feet can be placed anywhere on the same plane of existence, however far apart. They allow anyone to travel from one foot to the other in the blink of an eye. Be careful not to lose them

Mask of Revik - Revik forged this mask with his mischievous essence. The wearer can shape shift up to three times a day into any creature they have seen. There is a 25% chance that once a day the wearer will shape shift into a random creature against their will for one hour
Hammer of Doom - This unwieldy hammer is -10 to hit, but deals {@damage 4d12} corruption damage on a hit.

Throne of Xarexoth - This throne fits into the palm of your hand. When placed on the ground, its owner can say its command word. The throne grows up to their size. They can spend an hour sitting on the throne to regain the use of a spent spell. Usable only once per day
Skewer of the Gods - This spear deals {@damage 1d12} damage. If the wielder downs an enemy with it, as a bonus they can restore {@dice 2d6} health to any ally

Charred Collar - This dog collar must be worn. As an action, the wearer can summon a hellhound. This hound is loyal only to the wearer. The hound has its own turn in combat. The hound can be dismissed at will
Dagger of Blinding - This dagger deals {@damage 1d4} damage and there a 25% chance the target is blinded for 2 turns
Bow of Thunder - A normal looking longbow with an engraved lightning pattern. The bow performs normally except that on a critical hit it causes {@damage 3d8} thunder damage

Amulet of Radiance - When activated, it emits a radiant aura in a radius of 15ft around the wearer. During odd rounds it deals {@damage 2d8} holy damage to all hostiles within 15ft. During even rounds it heals the wearer and their allies within the radius for {@dice 2d6} health. It lasts for the entirety of the skirmish, or until the wearer is incapacitated. Can only be used once per day

Amulet of Death - This amulet holds a small piece of the wearers soul. When the wearer is dropped to 0 health this amulet revives them 30ft from where they dropped, and brings them back to full health. After one use the amulet breaks and the wearer's health is reduced by 5

Blade of Dehydration - After one successful attack the target has a 50% chance of being exhausted. On a second successful attack there is a 75% chance. On a third successful attack the target is exhausted

Crown of Storms - This crown grants resistance to storm damage. As a bonus, it can deal {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to anyone within 5ft of the wearer. This crown also allows the wearer to combine the entirety of the "Storm" items, assuming they have the other items
Helmet of Breathing - This helmet allows the wearer to breath underwater and keeps them from being poisoned by toxic clouds
Helmet of Silence - This helmet renders the wearer mute, however they can now speak to anyone telepathically up to 120ft away
Bipolar Axe - This battleaxe adds an extra {@damage 1d6} to its damage rolls. This damage alternates between fire and ice damage each attack

Necromancer's Stone - This stone can raise up to {@dice 1d20} corpses from the grave once a week. The zombies serve the wielder until they die a second time. Upon their second death, they burst into a cloud of dust
Armor of Notes - Doubles the wearer's musical proficiency and allows the wearer to cast a charm spell once per day
Bow of Storms - This bow deals {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. It has a range of 60/300ft. Arrows of lightning appear when user draws the bow
Soulbound Spellbook - This spellbook is blank, indestructible, and can't be read by anyone but the user. If this spellbook is lost, it can be summoned at will
Rod of Detection - This rod allows the wielder to know the location of any unseen creature within 100ft. Can be used 4 times a day
Rock of Ages - This rock can be thrown (60ft) or used as a melee weapon. The rock deals {@damage 1d8} damage. After being thrown the rock reappears in the user's hand
Control rod - This rod grants the wielder the ability to summon a stone golem. This golem springs from the ground, and is under the wielder's control. The golem can be dismissed at will
Bottle of Lightning - This bottle can be thrown 60ft. Once it hits the ground, it will shatter dealing {@damage 3d8} lightning damage. Once used, this item is gone forever
Helm of the Bull - A helmet with bull horns. Gives the wearer bonus on all strength related skills and checks. Once during combat the wearer can perform a charge action dealing {@damage 3d10} damage.
Hiking Boots - These boots remove any penalties to movement caused by terrain and increase the wearer's base walking speed by 5ft
Armor of Storms - This set of light armor grants +3. When the wearer is hit with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage
Mask of Glaring - This mask gives proficiency in intimidation. If already proficient, it gives double proficiency. It also allows the wearer to cast a {@dice 1d4} charm spells per day

Rabbit's Foot - A seemingly ordinary lucky rabbit's foot. Reroll all critical fails in the same encounter. Can be used in three encounters per day. The holder can also call all rabbits in a 500 foot radius to their aid. Lasts for the duration of the encounter.
Orb of Destruction- This silver orb is 6in wide in diameter. Once per day the user can cause the orb to send out a destructive cone 100ft long and 50ft wide that does 10D10 damage

Crown of Embers - This crown allows the wearer to breathe fire three times per day. The line is 5ft wide and 20ft long and does {@damage 3d6} fire damage. While wearing this the wearer can use all of the items belong to the set of Embers
Book of Summoning - This book allows the wielder to summon a single creature from a different dimension once every week
Helm of Adontag - This helmet grants immunity to being charmed, or put to sleep
Armor of Rage - Made from a mythical animal hide this armor grants an extra {@damage 1d4} to any barehanded or melee attack. The wearer's power is in their rage

Mace of Embers - This mace deals {@damage 1d8} damage and {@damage 2d8} fire damage. If the damage dealt exceeds the remaining health of the target, whatever additional damage rolls over to the wielder's next attack. This damage is lost if the mace isn't used by the end of the following turn

Mysterious Concoction - This small glass vial has a strange liquid inside. If ingested, roll {@dice 1d6}. 1) One ability score increases by 1 point. 2) One ability score decreases by 1 point. 3) Grows wings with a flight speed of 60ft. 4) Goes blind in one eye. 5) Gain the ability to breathe underwater indefinitely. 6) Face is marred by a terrible scar

Chakram Of Devotion - A thrown weapon with a maximum range of 100ft and it deals {@damage 1d6} damage. The chakram has two attacks. The first is the initial throw and the second attack is the chakram returning to the wielder. The wielder may choose a new target or same target. The chakram always comes back, without fail
Gloves of Healing - These gloves allow the user to cast a heal spell at will

Bag of Sleeping - Allows a creature to survive inside of it indefinitely in a very deep sleep. Only creatures of human size or smaller can fit inside. Once a creature is removed from the bag of sleeping, it requires 15 minutes before it can wake up

Maggot King's Crown - This crown allows the wearer to summon {@dice 1d6} zombies. The zombies act on their own turn under the direction of the wearer, and last until defeated or dismissed. Can be used up to three times per day
Ring of Clarity - Grants the wearer +2 to all skill rolls.
Wand of Wonders - This wand allows its wielder to use one low-level spell without cost any number of times. Player chooses the spell. Once the spell is chosen it cannot be changed
Flask of Xengarth - This flask has unlimited uses. When a character drinks from it, they regain {@dice 1d6} health
Cloak of Time - This cloak allows the user glimpse into the future. Any attack against them has is at disadvantage and any dexterity related reaction is at advantage

Cloak of Shadow - The wearer gains proficiency in stealth. If the hood is up, the wearer can see clearly up to 15ft in both magical and non-magical darkness and also becomes invisible when hiding in shadows
Sword of Storms - This longsword deals only lightning damage. On a critical hit it deals half damage to all enemies within 5ft of the target, and ¼ damage to all enemies within 10ft of the target
Death's Scythe - Damage: {@damage 1d10} slashing + {@damage 2d8} corruption damage. The wielder of this scythe heals for half (rounded down) of the damage dealt

Amulet of Heresy - When activated, it emits a radiant aura in a radius of 15ft around the wearer. During odd rounds it deals {@damage 2d8} corruption damage to all hostiles within 15ft. During even rounds it heals the wearer and their allies within the radius for {@dice 2d6} health. It lasts for the entirety of the skirmish, or until the wearer is incapacitated. Can only be used once per day
Staff of Heresy - If used in melee it deals {@damage 1d8}, plus an additional {@damage 2d6} corruption damage. It can also be used to drain {@damage 1d8} health from a target 6 times per day
Ring of Death - When the wearer kills something, they can use an action to turn that person or animal into an undead minion. It can be used three times a day and the creature fades after one hour

Amulet of Memories - This amulet allows the user to store their memories inside of it. These memories can be viewed by anyone who wears the amulet, seeing everything through the original user's perspective. When found, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, there is a memory already inside

Toy Dragon - As an action, its owner may say the command word. This toy dragon will grow to the size of a young dragon. Its owner must use their action to control the dragon. By repeating the command word, the dragon is dismissed
Crown of Ice - Three times a day the wearer can breathe icy cold air in a 15ft cone dealing {@damage 4d6} cold damage. This crown also allows the wearer to all the items in Ice set

Toy Ship - This ship can be set in the water. After its owner says the command word, it becomes a full size galley with a ghost crew loyal to the owner of the ship. Repeating the command word returns the ship to toy size
Bracers of Battle - These bracers can magically store one shield and one melee weapon. When combat begins the wearer can equip the stored items automatically
Mace of Hazards - This mace gives an advantage to all melee attacks against the wielder, but deals {@damage 4d8} damage. It also gives the wielder two reactions
Shield of Embers - This shield grants resistance to fire damage. Also, it gives an advantage to avoid fire damage
Cowl of Luck - While equipped, this Cowl grants the wearer good luck. Once per round, when the wearer is attacked, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, the attack automatically misses

Glass Eye - This glass eye can be placed anywhere. Once placed, say its command word. This eye gives its user the ability to see what it sees. The link can only be broken when the user and the eye are no longer on the same plane of existence. You can only see what the eye sees, there is no sound/smell

Toy Horse - As an action, the owner of this horse can say its command word. The horse changes from a small wooden toy to a full grown, live horse. As an action its owner can say the command word, and it will revert back into a toy.
Robes of Insight - These robes grant +3 to intelligence to the wearer
Ring of Spiders - This ring allows the wearer to summon {@dice 1d4} giant spiders. These spiders are completely under the wearer's control
Raven's Feather - A seemingly normal raven's feather attached to a bit of cord. The user can transform into a raven three times per day. The effect lasts for one hour
Magic Broom - This broom can be mounted. It has a flying speed of 60ft.

Toy Soldier - This object is a 6" tall representation of a soldier. Upon issuing the command word this toy soldier becomes a real soldier equipped with a long sword, a short sword, a heavy crossbow, and chainmail. It follows simple commands of its master, like attack enemies or guard a specific location. If reduced to 0 health, it reverts to the toy form and is shattered. If it reverts to the toy from before all health is exhausted it regains all of it for the next use
Staff of Radiance - If used in melee it deals {@damage 1d8}, plus an additional {@damage 2d6} holy damage. Plus it can also be used to heal the wearer or allies {@dice 2d6} heal 4 times a day

Jar of Ooze - This jar contains an ooze-like blob monster. If this jar is smashed on the ground the ooze is released. The ooze is hostile to everyone and everything. Once used, this item is lost forever

Survivor's Amulet - Each time the wearer takes damage roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll or 15-20, the wear only takes half damage. Also, three times per day the wearer can use the item to regain {@dice 2d6} health
Gloves of Striking - Unarmed damage is doubled

Soulbound Weapon - The wielder may use an action to summon this weapon in their empty hand. They can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time it is created. They are proficient with this weapon. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage
Boots of Swimming - These boots give the wearer a swimming speed of 60ft.
Enchanted Spoon - This spoon makes every meal taste like it was prepared by the gods. When any character eats a meal with this spoon they regain {@dice 1d8} health
Skull of a Demon Helm - It allows the wearer to take the form of a demon once a week, for 1 hour
Cloak of Feathers - This cloak allows the user to fly at a 60ft speed for up to four hours per day
Belt of Determination - This belt grants an advantage to all strength-based non-attack rolls

Boots of Blazing Speed - When activated, these boots grant the wearer a base speed of 120ft. However, at this speed, the wearer takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage for each turn they use more than half of their movement
Ring of Sorcery - Gives the wearer the ability to cast any two spells at will. Determine randomly

Dagger of Shadows - A +2 dagger that deals an additional {@damage 1d6} corruption damage. If the wielder is concealed by magical or non-magical darkness, the dagger deals {@damage 4d6} corruption damage
Gauntlets of Destruction - These gauntlets add {@damage 1d4} of fire damage to all melee attacks.
Socks of Comfort - These socks keep the wearer warm in extreme cold, and cool in extreme heat
Svaldr's Lucky Dagger - This dagger critical hits on a roll of 18-20. On a critical hit, it deals an extra {@damage 2d4} damage of the damage type to which the creature is vulnerable
Ring of Reaching - This ring allows you to extend your reach out to 10ft
Remorse - This mace refuses to kill. It will only knock creatures unconscious. It deals {@damage 1d6} nonlethal damage
Crown of Spiders - This crown allows the wearer to transform into a spider centaur at will.
Ring of Ice - This ring lets the wearer cast an ice spell at will

Doll House - This doll house is 5lbs, and about 10in tall by 10in wide. If set on the ground, its owner can say it's command word. It will grow to be a 3 story house, complete with a small cooking area, a dining room, and 5 bedrooms. It is a normal house, so it offers no protection from magic or intruders. Say the command word again, and the house will shrink back in size
Lute Of Legends - This lute gives the wielder double proficiency in performance. The wielder also gains advantage on any spell attack
Shield of Wrath - When the wielder is hit with a melee attack, they can use a reaction to bash the attacker with their shield for {@damage 2d4} damage
Robe of Dragonhide - This robe awards resistance to whichever dragon the hide is made of
Enchanted Vial Of Blood - When ingested, afflicts the drinker with lycanthropy. Roll {@dice 1d6}. 1) Wererat 2) Wereboar 3) Werewolf 4) Weretiger 5) Werebear 6) Player's choice.
Goggles of Reading - These goggles allow the user to understand any written language.

Amulet of Embers - The wearer releases a burst of flame in a 10ft radius each time they take 25 or more damage in a single round. This burst of flame affects friend and foe alike. It deals {@damage 3d4} fire damage
